## Ongoing

### Call for applications for two positions of ICPMF board member

ICPMF seeks exceptional candidates with a strong track record in the field of Predictive Microbiology and Food Modelling, to serve as ICPMF board member, developing activities related to the ICPMF mission and participating in the ICPMF board meetings in accordance with the by-laws:
- To foster the development and use of mathematical modelling in food science.
- To Improve Food Safety and Quality and Food Process Optimization through transferring the Know-How on Predictive Model to the different levels along the Food Chains.
- To create a strong predictive modeller community able to advance in Predictive Mathematical Tools for Food by increasing the presence in media, science, academia, etc.
- To develop educational programmes to train scientists, academia and food professionals in Predictive Modelling Tools in Foods.

The ICPMF member will be elected by vote for a 10-year term, for which a majority vote of all ICPMF current committee members will be required.
Candidates should submit an expression of interest and a maximum of two letters of support by e-mail to the ICPMF Chair ([koseki@agr.hokudai.ac.jp](koseki@agr.hokudai.ac.jp)) and secretary ([george.nychas@gmail.com](george.nychas@gmail.com)), no later than **31 January 2026**. The expression of interest should include the relevant achievements of the candidate in the field of Predictive Modelling in Food, motivation, the expected contribution to ICPMF activities, and other significant aspects related to the ICPMF mission and vision.
